19_4_24.name: Broken Coding
19_4_24.description:
Broken Coding is an exciting mini-game event that puts participants' coding skills to the test with a unique twist. After spinning the wheel, contestants are given a random question. The challenge comes in coding assignments where each input is transformed into a different letter, giving an exhilarating layer of unpredictability to the experience.

Participants must race against the clock to answer these code puzzles, with each second contributing toward their ultimate ranking. The faster they crack the code, the higher their ranking on the leaderboard.

The event offers a mix of excitement and smart thinking to deal with the setback and emerge successful.

19_4_24.name: Meme Mania
19_4_24.description: We are excited to propose the "Make Your Own Meme" event, an innovative and engaging contest designed to unleash the creativity of our college students through the medium of memes. Participants will be given a selection of meme templates, including both popular and custom designs related to college life, from which they can create their own unique memes. These creations will then be proudly displayed on the notice board at the Reception/E Block entrance, allowing the entire college community to enjoy and appreciate the humor and creativity of their peers. To celebrate the creativity and effort of our participants, the creators of the top memes, as determined by a combination of peer votes and a panel of judges, will be awarded exciting prizes. These prizes are designed to not only reward their ingenuity but also to encourage continued creative and positive expression. We emphasize the importance of respectful and inclusive humor in this contest; therefore, all submissions must be free from offensive content, adhering to our college's values of positivity and respect. This initiative aims not only to provide a platform for student expression but also to foster a sense of community and shared enjoyment within our college environment.

19_4_24.name: Pixalated Playoffs
19_4_24.description:
FORGE presents the Pixalated Playoffs, a thrilling gaming triathlon featuring three of your favorite titles: Valorant, FIFA, and BGMI.

Valorant: This single-elimination tournament features random seeding, giving every team a fair shot at glory. One loss and your run is over, so assemble your best five-stack and dominate the competition.

BGMI: Calling all Battle Royale champions! Put your strategic thinking and survival skills to the test in this intense BGMI tournament.

FIFA: ⚽️ A single-elimination bracket throws you into fresh matchups based on random seeding. Do you have the lightning-fast reflexes, tactical mastery, and pinpoint finesse shots to claim the championship title?

19_4_24.name: Riddleverse
19_4_24.description:
Explore the Multiverse of Riddles where riddles reign supreme!

Put yourself though 3 fun rounds.

1) Engage your intellect in “The Written Enigma" as you unravel the mysteries hidden within each enigma.

2) Unleash your creativity in “Decode & Draw”, where your sketches hold the key to unlocking the next challenge.

3) And in “The Charades Challenge”, let your imagination run wild as you act out clues with flair.

Get ready to immerse yourself in the enchanting world of riddles, where every solution brings you closer to enlightenment!

19_4_24.name: ROBO-RACE
19_4_24.description:
The objective of the event is to capture the attention of students towards robotics. A Bluetooth controlled bot will be given to the students to operate on an obstacle track. Robots will navigate a challenging race track filled with bridges and sharp turns.

Competitors must showcase agility and speed as they strive to cover the course in record time.

19_4_24.name: Solo Dance Competition
19_4_24.description: A dance battle between individual dancers showcase their talent and creativity in various styles. Judges evaluate dancers based on Factors. This is categorised into two : Western and Classical.

19_4_24.name: Group Dance Competition
19_4_24.description: A dance battle between group of dancers showcase their talent and creativity together in various styles. Judges evaluate them based on factors.

19_4_24.name: Street Dance
19_4_24.description: A dance battle on the streets of Fountain Road. There will be teams consisting of 4-5 people each, battling against each other. The competition would contain 2 rounds, the first one being a Selection round based on performances and the second one being an Impromptu Dance round. The teams must choose only Beats, EDMs, Raps and Tunes. No lyrics are allowed. The team that does the best during the final round wins.

19_4_24.name: Virtual Stock market
19_4_24.description: Join our Virtual Stock Market Challenge for a dynamic simulation of stock Market. Participants will experience real-time market conditions, make strategic decisions, and analyze portfolio performance. Register by Virtual app to compete for top rankings on the leaderboard and win prizes. The event offers a risk-free environment to hone investment skills, learn about market dynamics, and network with peers. Don't miss this opportunity to gain practical trading experience and test your financial acumen

19_4_24.name: Cadence Quest
19_4_24.description:
ROUND – 1

Solo Singing:

Contestants get to perform classical and film songs to showcase their vocal skills The contestant is free to choose both the rounds Contestants who are a part of RAAGA should share their journey in RAAGA, a few things about their life, etc through a short video of 50 seconds. (Note: Approach AOC).
      Solo Instrumental:

Instrumentalists perform classical or film pieces, demonstrating their mastery of their chosen instrument Contestants who are a part of RAAGA should share their journey in RAAGA, a few things about their life, etc through a short video of 50 seconds. (Note: Approach AOC)


ROUND – 2:

Solo Singing:

The top 6 singers (3 classical, 3 films) advance to the "Battle round." In this round, pairs of singers are formed and each pair selects a song mashup from a chit. They compete against each other in a vocal showdown, with the twist being that they must also impress the judges compared to the other pairs. The best battle within the pairs advances to determine the overall winner of the solo singing competition.

Solo Instrumental:

The top 3 instrumentalists advance to the "Abstract round." In this round, instrumentalists have the freedom to play any piece they desire, showcasing their creativity, technical skill, and musicality.

19_4_24.name: Dramatic Harmonies
19_4_24.description: The event comprises a single round where Abhinaya selects a chit from a bowl containing song names and enacts the title of the chosen song. Raaga participants then engage by guessing the song and proceeding to sing it out.

19_4_24.name: Art Exhibition
19_4_24.description: A display of various artworks, showcasing the talents and creativity of different artists.

19_4_24.name: Art Stalls and Events
19_4_24.description:
STALLS:
Bookmarks Stall: A cozy nook offering an assortment of creatively designed bookmarks for literary enthusiasts to mark their pages in style.
Crochet Stall: A stall offering handmade plush items crafted using crochet techniques.
Jewelry Stall: A stall showcasing a variety of jewelry pieces, including necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and rings, made from various materials like chains,charms, and beads.
Resin Art Stall (Pendants, Keychains): A stall featuring unique pendants and keychains made from resin.
Charm Bracelet Making Live Stall (day1): A live stall providing materials and guidance for visitors to create personalized charm bracelets, often featuring an assortment of charms and beads.
Mehendi Live Stall(day1): A live stall where skilled artists create intricate henna designs (mehendi) on participants' hands.
Nail Art Live Stall (day2): A live stall offering nail art services, where we decorate nails with various designs, colors, and embellishments.

EVENTS:
Drawing competition: A short drawing challenge will be given to the artist which is time bound. Best art after the time ends wins.
1min, 30 sec, 10 sec drawing challenge: Contestants will have 1 minute, 30 seconds, and 10 seconds to replicate the pose demonstrated by an executive through drawing. The most accurate rendition wins.

19_4_24.name: WHO IS THE CHEATER?
19_4_24.description: Persons will be made to sit in groups of 4-6 depending upon no. of participants, link will be sent to their mobiles and one executive will be standing behind each of them. Questions related to Indian Mythology will be asked in the link and on taping it answer will also be displayed. Persons who raise their hands first after displaying the question, they can answer, and other persons will be guessing if the person has cheated or not. If the persons guess is correct, he will be getting the points, otherwise there will be negative marking, and the person who has answered will be getting the points. It will be played in three rounds, each time two persons will be selected for next round.

19_4_24.name: Fun Games
19_4_24.description:
1) Blindfold Labyrinth
2) Poisonous Stump
3) Ball Bucket
The three events will be conducted in a team of 3 to 4.  A fun filled and team activity. Where it tests the potential of an individual and the trust on their teammates. The understanding between each other and the communication plays a important role in the activities mentioned above.

19_4_24.name: Thread of Kindness
19_4_24.description: As part of this cloth donation drive, drop boxes will be placed at designed locations within our college to facilitate the collection of old clothes from donors. To ensure the impact of our guide, we will be circulating a detailed guidelines of what can and cannot be donated. All the donated clothes will be donated to NGO Goonj

20_4_24.name: Thread of Kindness
20_4_24.description: As part of this cloth donation drive, drop boxes will be placed at designed locations within our college to facilitate the collection of old clothes from donors. To ensure the impact of our guide, we will be circulating a detailed guidelines of what can and cannot be donated. All the donated clothes will be donated to NGO Goonj

20_4_24.name: Shark Tank
20_4_24.description: Inspired from the show Shark Tank while including an interesting twist. A set of slides that present Products and absurd and creative features where the contestants must pitch for funding by using the details provided from the slides. Use your impromptu skills to steal the best deal. Your by entrepreneurship and impromptu skills are put to the test by evaluating how well you use the details from the slides to your advantage.

20_4_24.name: Tug of War
20_4_24.description: A fun filled and team activity. Where it tests the potential of an individual and the trust on their teammates. The understanding between each other and the communication plays a important role in the activities mentioned above.

20_4_24.name: Street Dance
20_4_24.description: A dance battle on the streets of Fountain Road. There will be teams consisting of 4-5 people each, battling against each other. The competition would contain 2 rounds, the first one being a Selection round based on performances and the second one being an Impromptu Dance round. The teams must choose only Beats, EDMs, Raps and Tunes. No lyrics are allowed. The team that does the best during the final round wins.

20_4_24.name: Ctrl Alt Jeopardy
20_4_24.description:
A trivia game show hosted at our own college. The basic format is 3 - 4 teams will clash in a battle of wits, answering trivia questions in the classic Jeopardy!

The game board will feature six categories with five clues each, ranging in difficulty from 200 brain points (easy) to 1000 brain points (super challenging).

Just like the original show, each clue will be phrased as an answer. Remember, your response needs to be a question starting with "What is...?"

Think fast! The first team to buzz in with the correct answer gets to claim the points. But there's a twist! Buzz in with the wrong answer, and your team loses the points you wagered on that clue.

Power-Up Rounds:

Final Jeopardy!: After all the categories of the first board have been revealed, the top two teams face off in the ultimate final battle of lightening round.0020

20_4_24.name: Science Spotlight-An Intriguing Segment
20_4_24.description:
Simple and Entertaining Experiments

Elephant Toothpaste: Mix hydrogen peroxide, dish soap, and yeast to create a foamy eruption that resembles toothpaste for an elephant! It's visually stunning and safe to do with proper precautions.

Pasta Tower Challenge: Provide participants with uncooked spaghetti noodles and marshmallows or gumdrops, and challenge them to build the tallest freestanding tower possible. It's a fun way to explore principles of stability and structural engineering.

Seltzer Bottle Rockets: Create simple rockets using empty seltzer bottles, water, and a bike pump or air compressor. Participants can experiment with different water levels and air pressures to achieve maximum launch height.

Aluminum Foil Boats: Give participants a sheet of aluminum foil and challenge them to fold it into a boat that can float and hold the most weight (such as pennies or marbles) without sinking.

Paper Airplane Challenge: Have participants fold a paper airplane using a standard sheet of paper, and challenge them to design and fold the airplane that can fly the farthest or stay in the air the longest.

Invisible Ink: Create invisible ink using lemon juice, baking soda solution, or milk. Write secret messages with the invisible ink and reveal them using heat (such as holding the paper near a light bulb) or by applying a developing agent (such as iodine vapor).

20_4_24.name: BEST ACTOR/ACTRESS
20_4_24.description: The "Best Actor" event is a highly anticipated competition that brings together theater performers to showcase their talent and skill in captivating and immersive performances. It features challenges that test actors' abilities to think creatively, collaborate effectively, and portray a diverse range of characters with authenticity and depth. The event not only celebrates the art of acting but also fosters a sense of camaraderie and mutual respect among performers, making it a vibrant and enriching experience for both participants and audience members alike.

20_4_24.name: Lit-Day, Open Mic & Literature Treasure Hunt
20_4_24.description: Literature Day will be an event filled with magic of literature, people dressing up, book fairs and so on. The Open Mic is an opportunity to showcase all your skills through the magic of words.The Literature Treasure hunt will bring stories to life.

20_4_24.name: Escape Room
20_4_24.description: The objective of the game is for players to escape from a room by solving a series of entertaining riddles and answering questions. The team that escapes the room in the shortest amount of time and with minimal hints will win the game.

20_4_24.name: AI Artistry & PrisonCTF
20_4_24.description:
Microsoft Ignite Students Club presents a dynamic event featuring two engaging rounds that challenge participants' skills in AI artistry and cybersecurity. The participants will delve into the realms of picture generation using AI and prompt injection questions to capture flags in a CTF challenge.

Round 1: AI Artistry (45 mins)

In this round, participants will demonstrate their creativity and AI prowess by generating images similar to or inspired by given pictures using AI algorithms. Additionally, they'll use provided text prompts to generate related textual content.

Round 2: PrisonCTF (1 hour)

Participants will engage in a Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge where they'll prompt injection questions to retrieve flags, showcasing their cybersecurity knowledge and problem-solving skills.

20_4_24.name: DEBATE ON THE DILEMMAS AND CONTROVERSIES OF THE INDIAN MYTHOLOGY
20_4_24.description: Topics related to Indian Mythology will be given that is a little controversial and have a dilemma, two persons will be there, one will be speaking in support of the statement and the second will be speaking against it. The time given will be 1 minute for the debate, and 30 secs will be given to think after the topic is given, topics will be given randomly, those who don't know about the topic will be given information about the topic. The persons have to put their statements one after the other in that 1 minute. The judge will evaluate them and results will be declared.

20_4_24.name: Seminar On 'Serpentine Chronicles : All about snakes'
20_4_24.description: Dive deep into the captivating world of snakes with our seminar, 'Serpentine Chronicles.' In this seminar, we'll explore the biology, ecology, behaviour, and cultural significance of these remarkable reptiles.  A herpetologist who previously worked as a professor in IISC bengaluru ,will lead discussions on topics such as snake diversity, venomous vs. non-venomous species, ecological roles, conservation efforts, and the coexistence of snakes with human populations.

20_4_24.name: Cinematic Adventure
20_4_24.description:
In this event attendees will go on an exciting quest for knowledge as they take part in a genre hunt. Teams of up to four people will seek the allotted region for their assigned genre, using only their wits and the clues provided.
    After the genre has been identified, participants will have the chance to let their imaginations go wild and create an engrossing five to ten minute short film or scenario that perfectly captures the essence of the identified genre.
